intro: Erysimum violaceum, commonly known as the violet broomweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Erysimum violaceum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
